alert.note: Alert for Clay; Leslie; Owsley; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 5:18PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Owsley, northwestern Leslie, west central Perry and northeastern Clay Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 517 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tanksley, or near Manchester, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Enline and Peabody around 525 PM EDT. Brutus, Jacks Creek, Newfound, Big Creek and Bear Branch around 530 PM EDT. Panco, Whoopflarea, Sizerock, Mistletoe and Bobs Fork around 535 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Saul, Buckhorn, Shoal, Kaliopi and Thousandsticks. THIS INCLUDES Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 21 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
